Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2008 08:01PM Rachelgators wrote: Hi, I had a left mastectomy on 12/21/07 and had my first TC chemo treatment on February 7. My second tx was this past Thursday, the 28th. Things have been going okay. My hair started coming out in handfuls last Monday, so I had it shaved on Wednesday of last week (see my pic). Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2008 11:28PM Rachelgators wrote: Hello all! I went to the American Cancer Society today for a wig and some hats, etc. I am not sure how much I will wear the wig. I like it, but it's so much unlike my real hair that it's a little uncomfortable. I have a ton of cool hats. I don't work in an office, so it wouldn't matter if I went around all day without anything on my bald head! The weather has been about 80 degrees here anyway, so a wig is a little hot. Tomorrow we are going to be in the 60s, though. Tonight at Shabbat services my rabbi gave me a hat from a company called Hats of Hope. It has the healing prayer on the inside of the hat and the word "hope" on the inside brim (so I can look up and see the word while I am wearing it). I was very touched, actually. I have been feeling very bloated. I get full so fast and then I never feel like I have an appetite again. I have the dry mouth and heartburn too. My period did not come yet, and I have the feeling that it won't. That's just going to make me feel more bloated, I know it. Chris:Â  I am 39. I work at home as a medical transcriptionist, although I have not worked since my mastectomy in December. My kids are 14, 10, and 6. I have great support from my husband and friends. This whole experience has showed me how lucky I really am. Welcome to the group. Rachel

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2008 03:57PM Rachelgators wrote: Donnalee, I definitely got a lot out of the LGFB class. Still getting used to having people try not to look at me weird with my head wrap on. Not good for the wallet! The problem is that I am short and a plus size. Finding pants/shorts is impossible.
